| Improve this Doc View Source

APIAuthentication(String, String)

Instantiates a new Authentication object with the given apiKey, which may be null. For users who belong to multiple organizations, you can specify which organization is used. Usage from these API requests will count against the specified organization's subscription quota.

Declaration
public APIAuthentication(string apiKey, string openAIOrganization)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String apiKey

The API key, required to access the API endpoint.
System.String openAIOrganization

The Organization ID to count API requests against. This can be found at https://beta.openai.com/account/org-settings.

Default

The default authentication to use when no other auth is specified. This can be set manually, or automatically loaded via environment variables or a config file. LoadFromEnv()LoadFromPath(String, String, Boolean)

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

LoadFromEnv()

Attempts to load api key from environment variables, as "OPENAI_KEY" or "OPENAI_API_KEY". Also loads org if from "OPENAI_ORGANIZATION" if present.

Declaration
public static APIAuthentication LoadFromEnv()
Returns
Type Description
APIAuthentication

Returns the loaded APIAuthentication any api keys were found, or null if there were no matching environment vars.
| Improve this Doc View Source

LoadFromPath(String, String, Boolean)

Attempts to load api keys from a configuration file, by default ".openai" in the current directory, optionally traversing up the directory tree

Declaration
public static APIAuthentication LoadFromPath(string directory = null, string filename = ".openai", bool searchUp = true)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String directory

The directory to look in, or null for the current directory
System.String filename

The filename of the config file
System.Boolean searchUp

Whether to recursively traverse up the directory tree if the filename is not found in the directory
Returns
Type Description
APIAuthentication

Returns the loaded APIAuthentication any api keys were found, or null if it was not successful in finding a config (or if the config file didn't contain correctly formatted API keys)
| Improve this Doc View Source

ValidateAPIKey()

Tests the api key against the OpenAI API, to ensure it is valid. This hits the models endpoint so should not be charged for usage.

Declaration
public async Task<bool> ValidateAPIKey()
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.Boolean>

true if the api key is valid, or false if empty or not accepted by the OpenAI API.

Operators

| Improve this Doc View Source

Implicit(String to APIAuthentication)

Allows implicit casting from a string, so that a simple string API key can be provided in place of an instance of APIAuthentication

Declaration
public static implicit operator APIAuthentication(string key)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String key

The API key to convert into a APIAuthentication.
